    "the other day": 
        "reviews": 
            
                "my brother made a movie called \"Those Other Days\" but it's not on letterboxd so this is as close as we'll get for now",
                "For me, the problem with Minh's films has always been that he usually has a lot of resources to go full vision, so, like all of the up and coming directors, he tended to include all of the shots he shot in the finished cut.\"Have you thought of other men while having sex with me?\"\"Yes, chairman Mao\"🤣🤣🤣🤣 I literally could not stop laughing.and also i didnt finish it lol, would like to rewatch with someone.\"Four queer stories revolve around crimes of passion, matricide, vampires and two college roommates, connected by a filmmaker's mockumentary.\"",
                "asian-american queer cinema never lets me down",
                "This review may contain spoilers.A queer retelling of queer artmaking and lifeliving.Peep the UCLA Melnitz jump scare lol"

                "Have you ever thought about other men when you're having sex with me?\"Have you thought of other men while having sex with me?\"\"Yes, chairman Mao\"🤣🤣🤣🤣 I literally could not stop laughing.A number of very tender and beautiful moments, but like all things in this film, some work better than others.,
                "i mean... whatever this film is about...just trust, you'd understand everything by the last film an actual good movie, it's fun to interpret it :))",
                "ร้อยเรียงเรื่องราวจาก home VDO ที่เล่าและเปลือยตัวตนผ่านกล้อง fiction ทั้งในส่วนของการสอบสวน เหนือจริงด้วยเรื่องของคู่รักแวมไพร์ และปิดจบด้วยชีวิตเกย์ Asian-American วัยเรียนชอบความดิบที่นำเสนอในเรื่องแรก และน่าต่อยอดมากๆ ในเรื่องสองและสาม แต่เหมือนว่า Highlight ของหนังจริงๆ อยู่ที่เรื่องสุดท้ายที่แสนไหววูบและ coming-of-ตัวตน มากๆ",
                "So much ingenuity, so much spite, so much reconciliation."Stumbled on a tape of this at We Luv Video and really enjoyed it.and also i didnt finish it lol, would like to rewatch with someone.\"Four queer stories revolve around crimes of passion, matricide, vampires and two college roommates, connected by a filmmaker's mockumentary.\"",
                "asian-american queer cinema never lets me down",
                "This review may contain spoilers.Peep the UCLA Melnitz jump scare lol"
